title.value: Refining SARS-CoV-2 Intra-host Variation by Leveraging Large-scale Sequencing Data
title.justification: The title is mentioned at the beginning of the document and captures the essence of the paper, which is about refining intra-host variation in SARS-CoV-2 using large-scale sequencing data.
title.quote: Refining SARS-CoV-2 Intra-host Variation by Leveraging Large-scale Sequencing Data

extractions.description: The paper presents a workflow for enhancing the detection reliability of intra-host single nucleotide variants (iSNVs) in SARS-CoV-2 using over 130,000 publicly available NGS libraries. It addresses challenges related to sequencing errors and introduces quality control metrics, dimensionality reduction methods, and visualizations to correctly identify viral mutations.

type.justification: The paper focuses on analyzing a large dataset of SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data to derive empirical results about intra-host variations, which is characteristic of empirical studies.
type.quote: We processed 128,423 high-quality SARS-CoV-2 sequencing libraries from the first two years of the COVID-19 pandemic, ensuring a representative sampling across time and geographic locations.

name.justification: The paper is centered on the analysis of SARS-CoV-2 genomic data to understand viral evolution and intra-host variation.
name.quote: The advancements in high-throughput sequencing technologies have revolutionized the study of viral genomes, particularly evident in the case of SARS-CoV-2 during the COVID-19 pandemic.

name.justification: The use of bioinformatics tools and workflows is integral to processing and analyzing the large-scale sequencing data in this study.
name.quote: Our workflow is divided into two levels: the processing and quality control of a set of libraries... and the processing and quality control of iSNVs within each library.

name.justification: PHATE is highlighted as a novel dimensionality reduction method applied in this study to visualize high-dimensional genomic data.
name.quote: We pioneer the application of the PHATE visualization approach to genomic data and introduce a methodology that quantifies how related groups of data points are within a two-dimensional space.

is_contributed.justification: PHATE is described as a method applied in the study, rather than a novel contribution specific to this research.
is_contributed.quote: Despite the potential of these methods, their application to the extensive SARS-CoV-2 data has been limited, often confined to analyzing consensus sequences.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of executing PHATE on GPU or CPU in the provided text.
is_executed.quote: Despite the potential of these methods, their application to the extensive SARS-CoV-2 data has been limited, often confined to analyzing consensus sequences.

is_compared.justification: PHATE is a visualization technique and doesn't seem to be numerically compared to other models in terms of performance.
is_compared.quote: The PHATE representation of the unfiltered de novo iSNVs prominently identifies the Wellcome Sanger Institute as a major cluster.

referenced_paper_title.value: Visualizing structure and transitions in high-dimensional biological data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is a known source that explains PHATE's methodology.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Moon K. R. et al. 2019. Visualizing structure and transitions in high-dimensional biological data.

name.justification: The study explicitly mentions the use of over 130,000 publicly available SARS-CoV-2 NGS libraries to demonstrate their workflow.
name.quote: We processed 128,423 high-quality SARS-CoV-2 sequencing libraries from the first two years of the COVID-19 pandemic.

referenced_paper_title.value: Global landscape of SARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance and data sharing
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of the SARS-CoV-2 genomic data that would include such large-scale NGS datasets.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Chen Z. et al. 2022. Global landscape of SARS-CoV-2 genomic surveillance and data sharing.

name.justification: iVar is used as part of the analysis pipeline for primer trimming and consensus sequence generation in the study.
name.quote: For each library, Illumina sequencing adapters and bad-quality reads were trimmed... The trimmed libraries were mapped to the SARS-CoV-2 reference genome... We used the iVar pipeline for primer trimming.

referenced_paper_title.value: An amplicon-based sequencing framework for accurately measuring intrahost virus diversity using PrimalSeq and iVar
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is directly referenced in association with the iVar's functions used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Grubaugh N. D. et al. 2019. An amplicon-based sequencing framework for accurately measuring intrahost virus diversity using PrimalSeq and iVar.
